body:
איכה תאמרו חכמים אנחנו ותורת 𐤉𐤄𐤅𐤄 אתנו אכן הנה לשקר עשה עט שקר ספרים׃

How can you say "we are wise, and 𐤉𐤄𐤅𐤄's law is with us" when in reality the deceitful pen of scribes lied?!
body_html:
איכה תאמרו חכמים אנחנו ותורת 𐤉𐤄𐤅𐤄 אתנו אכן הנה לשקר עשה עט שקר ספרים׃

How can you say "we are wise, and 𐤉𐤄𐤅𐤄's law is with us" when in reality the deceitful pen of scribes lied?!

guild.description:
"For God so loved the world, that He gave His only begotten Son, that whoever believes in Him shall not perish, but have eternal life. For God did not send the Son into the world to judge the world, but that the world might be saved through Him. He who believes in Him is not judged; he who does not believe has been judged already, because he has not believed in the name of the only begotten Son of God. This is the judgment, that the Light has come into the world, and men loved the darkness rather than the Light, for their deeds were evil. For everyone who does evil hates the Light, and does not come to the Light for fear that his deeds will be exposed. But he who practices the truth comes to the Light, so that his deeds may be manifested as having been wrought in God."

May all personally encounter the presence and attention of the Lord God. 

Curiosity, questions, discussion, and prayer requests are welcome.

body: According to what definition? Technically it refers to anything that allows personal knowledge over church orthodoxy, thus making almost the whole of Protestantism gnostic, and I highly doubt that's how you meant it.

body:
I'm just curious where you stand with Jesus Christ. You spend a lot of time here tearing down people's ideas but I haven't seen you offer any alternatives.

I would define gnostic as a system where a select person or group has exclusive access to some knowledge of God.

body:
I tear down ideas because they are rooted not in Christ but politics. As it stands today most of Christianity is just a political and cultural movement with little spiritual focus. I can clearly see that a large number claim to believe not because they actually do, but because they value tradition (something specifically warned against), and Protestant Christianity is the tradition. You can see this because whenever Jesus contradicts the tradition, they will always choose tradition. And their biggest concerns are not the things Jesus constantly preached about, but pointless media controversies of the day. In addition, most of the focus seems to be on exalting ourselves while constantly putting others down. And we've strayed from the simple gospel into a mess of countless complicated doctrines and theology that make no difference and only serve as distractions and divisions, and often promote evil ideas. This is so much like the Pharisees that I legitimately feel like if Jesus came again now, most of us would be demanding to have him tortured and killed too.

> I would define gnostic as a system where a select person or group has exclusive access to some knowledge of God.

That defines the orthodoxy more than anything else

You can see this because whenever Jesus contradicts the tradition, they will always choose tradition. And their biggest concerns are not the things Jesus constantly preached about, but pointless media controversies of the day. In addition, most of the focus seems to be on exalting ourselves while constantly putting others down. And we've strayed from the simple gospel into a mess of countless complicated doctrines and theology that make no difference and only serve as distractions and divisions, and often promote evil ideas. This is so much like the Pharisees that I legitimately feel like if Jesus came again now, most of us would be demanding to have him tortured and killed too.

I would define gnostic as a system where a select person or group has exclusive access to some knowledge of God.

That defines the orthodoxy more than anything else

body: In ancient times, writing under a person's name when they couldn't, or adding a gloss or interpretation to a text while copying wasn't usually considered forgery. In many cases it was actually seen as an act of nobility. However, by accident or deliberate, it could give off the wrong ideas. In any case scribes rarely omitted text but they added a lot, especially in the very early days while redaction was taking place. This is also not horribly bad in the gospels, and Jesus's teaching is still discernible in them.
body_html: In ancient times, writing under a person's name when they couldn't, or adding a gloss or interpretation to a text while copying wasn't usually considered forgery. In many cases it was actually seen as an act of nobility. However, by accident or deliberate, it could give off the wrong ideas. In any case scribes rarely omitted text but they added a lot, especially in the very early days while redaction was taking place. This is also not horribly bad in the gospels, and Jesus's teaching is still discernible in them.

guild.description:
"For God so loved the world, that He gave His only begotten Son, that whoever believes in Him shall not perish, but have eternal life. For God did not send the Son into the world to judge the world, but that the world might be saved through Him. He who believes in Him is not judged; he who does not believe has been judged already, because he has not believed in the name of the only begotten Son of God. This is the judgment, that the Light has come into the world, and men loved the darkness rather than the Light, for their deeds were evil. For everyone who does evil hates the Light, and does not come to the Light for fear that his deeds will be exposed. But he who practices the truth comes to the Light, so that his deeds may be manifested as having been wrought in God."

May all personally encounter the presence and attention of the Lord God. 

Curiosity, questions, discussion, and prayer requests are welcome.

How can you say "we are wise, and 𐤉𐤄𐤅𐤄's law is with us" when in reality the deceitful pen of scribes lied?!

body: Judge it by its own merits. The New Testament writers and I think Jesus too also appealed to popular literature when it got their point across. There is one, or two, central commandments that govern everything else. If something doesn't line up with that it's suspect.

body:
> Do you believe the Bible is God's objective revelation to us?

No. The only authority we have on that is the catholic/orthodox church during the time of Constantine, which I don't trust. And an honest look at the book, or books rather, pretty much proves it's got some issues.

> Do you believe in any kind of special revelation?

There's prophecy, there's dreams, and there's typical revelations through thoughts. And there's also the moral compass.
body_html:
Do you believe the Bible is God's objective revelation to us?

No. The only authority we have on that is the catholic/orthodox church during the time of Constantine, which I don't trust. And an honest look at the book, or books rather, pretty much proves it's got some issues.

Do you believe in any kind of special revelation?

There's prophecy, there's dreams, and there's typical revelations through thoughts. And there's also the moral compass.

body: I think we can still get the idea from it. It's a text, but the issue is people seem to be valuing the text itself over the things the text is about, and won't admit when a few parts contradict the rest and we have to use some honest insight, leading to much confusion and distress. And they will also call mere writings made by fallible humans "perfect and infallible" simply because they are included in the same set of books, if the accuser himself wrote a book and it got put in the bible they would blindly believe everything it says.
body_html: I think we can still get the idea from it. It's a text, but the issue is people seem to be valuing the text itself over the things the text is about, and won't admit when a few parts contradict the rest and we have to use some honest insight, leading to much confusion and distress. And they will also call mere writings made by fallible humans "perfect and infallible" simply because they are included in the same set of books, if the accuser himself wrote a book and it got put in the bible they would blindly believe everything it says.

How can you say "we are wise, and 𐤉𐤄𐤅𐤄's law is with us" when in reality the deceitful pen of scribes lied?!
post.body_html:
איכה תאמרו חכמים אנחנו ותורת 𐤉𐤄𐤅𐤄 אתנו אכן הנה לשקר עשה עט שקר ספרים׃

How can you say "we are wise, and 𐤉𐤄𐤅𐤄's law is with us" when in reality the deceitful pen of scribes lied?!
post.title: Jeremiah 8:8

author.bio:
Goodbye. https://ruqqus.com/+The_Cabal/post/d9y9/i-told-you-so-all-the

Remember: History repeats, and the unaware are doomed to repeat it.
author.bio_html:
Goodbye. https://ruqqus.com/+The_Cabal/post/d9y9/i-told-you-so-all-the

Remember: History repeats, and the unaware are doomed to repeat it.

body: You won't find much reading on this. Just like in the time of the Pharisees, detraction from the "official" doctrines isn't popular, and since we are extremely tribalistic creatures only the ones who are messed up like me can see the problem, or rather are willing to see it, and the vast majority will blindly follow everyone else and shut out opposition. That may well be the only positive thing about me, otherwise I'm a talentless, annoying, selfish, knowledgeless, weak idiot who can't even handle minor discomfort.
body_html: You won't find much reading on this. Just like in the time of the Pharisees, detraction from the "official" doctrines isn't popular, and since we are extremely tribalistic creatures only the ones who are messed up like me can see the problem, or rather are willing to see it, and the vast majority will blindly follow everyone else and shut out opposition. That may well be the only positive thing about me, otherwise I'm a talentless, annoying, selfish, knowledgeless, weak idiot who can't even handle minor discomfort.

guild.description:
"For God so loved the world, that He gave His only begotten Son, that whoever believes in Him shall not perish, but have eternal life. For God did not send the Son into the world to judge the world, but that the world might be saved through Him. He who believes in Him is not judged; he who does not believe has been judged already, because he has not believed in the name of the only begotten Son of God. This is the judgment, that the Light has come into the world, and men loved the darkness rather than the Light, for their deeds were evil. For everyone who does evil hates the Light, and does not come to the Light for fear that his deeds will be exposed. But he who practices the truth comes to the Light, so that his deeds may be manifested as having been wrought in God."

May all personally encounter the presence and attention of the Lord God. 

Curiosity, questions, discussion, and prayer requests are welcome.

body: Also, I would suggest doing your own research and studies. Blindly listening to articles and podcasts is effectively following someone else, who often effectively brainwashes their listeners.
